array_option_1: What is the current state of the network?
What are the top senders/receivers of flows?
What are the top flows by organization?
What are the top flows by country?
What are flows by science discipline?
What is the aggregate flow data for data archives?
What do individual flows look like?
What are the current flow data summary statistics?
What is the state of active testing on the network?
What are the patterns of loss in the network?
What are the patterns of latency in the network?
What are the bandwidth patterns in the network?
What are the patterns in science data transfers in the network?

panels.content:
<center>This dashboard provides a summary of flow information from all Countries, Organizations, Protocols, and Ports.</center>
<!-- Global site tag (gtag.js) - Google Analytics -->
<script async src="https://www.googletagmanager.com/gtag/js?id=UA-142763676-1"></script>
<script>
  window.dataLayer = window.dataLayer || [];
  function gtag(){dataLayer.push(arguments);}
  gtag('js', new Date());

  gtag('config', 'UA-142763676-1');
</script>

panels.postfix: flows with only one end tagged in science registry

targets.query: meta.sensor_id.keyword:$sensors AND ( _exists_:meta.scireg.src.org_name.keyword  OR _exists_:meta.scireg.dst.org_name.keyword  ) AND NOT ( _exists_:meta.scireg.src.org_name.keyword  AND _exists_:meta.scireg.dst.org_name.keyword  )

panels.postfix: flows with both ends tagged in science registry

styles.linkTooltip: Click for more info about data traveling over the $__cell

panels.content: If you have any questions, concerns, or other issues, feel free to contact us at netsage@iu.edu. Thanks! NSF GRANT 1540933 To Review the NetSage Data Policy click here
